title: A model of optimization of foreign trade in a planned economy and its applications

reference.unstructured: A detailed discussion of the assumptions of this model, its complete mathematical structure, as well as the practical derivation of indexes of effectiveness are to be found in the present author's work: “Problems of a System of Complex Analysis of Current Effectiveness of Foreign Trade”, the Committee of Regional Planning of the Polish Academy of Sciences, Warsaw, 1961.

Studies concerning cost changes resulting from economies of scale as well as supply and demand elasticity are underway: they are concerned with determination of criteria of effectiveness of international division of labour between the Socialist countries, as well as with the model of optimization of foreign trade in long range planning.
c j includes labor cost of the last phase.
See the present author's article: “The model of optimization of regional allocation of foreign trade”,Gospodarka Planowa, 8–9/1961.

The assumption is made here that separate bilateral trade balances with each country are necessary. A similar system, however, may be set up on the basis of currency blocks involving a number of countries.

See the present author's articles: “Some problems of a complex system of analysis of current effectiveness of foreign trade”,Gospodarka Planowa, No. 4,5/1961; and “Criteria of current effectiveness and planning”,Handel Zagraniczny, No. 7/1961.
See the article by W. Piaszczyński on applications of operational calculus to problems of foreign trade,Gospodarka Planowa, No. 5/1961.

Indexes of effectiveness have been first derived from the model of optimization of foreign trade by J. Pajestka in his paper: “The problem of calculating rentability of foreign trade”,Ekonomista, No. 5, 1957. Correct mathematical derivation of the range of those indexes was undertaken by J. Mycielski and K. Rey; their study is to appear this year in theBulletin, Committee of Regional Planning of the Polish Academy of Sciences.
